result.execSummary:
The defendant Heather L. Adams was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: as a Party to a Crime, Conspiracy to Commit], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).
  • Theft-Movable Property-Special Facts [Modifiers: as a Party to a Crime, Conspiracy to Commit], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Theft-Movable Property-Special Facts [Modifiers: as a Party to a Crime, Conspiracy to Commit], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Theft-Movable Property-Special Facts [Modifiers: as a Party to a Crime, Conspiracy to Commit], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Theft-Movable Property-Special Facts [Modifiers: as a Party to a Crime, Conspiracy to Commit], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Defendant shall submit to a DNA sample at the Taylor County Sheriff's Department.
The jail sentence may be served with huber.  The huber may be used for child care and online education.

Defendant must maintain full time employment or school at the discretion of probation.  Defendant shall have no contact with co-defendants D.C., D.R. and N.H.  Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety.  Defendant must cot consume any controlled substances unless prescribed.  Defendant shall undergo counseling as deemed appropriate by probation.    Defendant shall pay supervision fees as ordered by the Department of Corrections. 
If probation is ordered and ultimately revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used.
Defendant shall undergo an AODA and comply with all treatment recommendations.

timeConds.notes:
The jail sentence shall begin no later than November 11, 2017 at 4:30 pm.  The defendant shall pay all sheriff and jail fees or costs allowed or imposed by law and the sheriff shall be entitled to a judgment against the defendant for any such unpaid fees or costs.  
Jail can be served in any county in the State of Wisconsin provided arrangements are made by counsel or the defendant, it is approved by the Taylor County Jail, and at no additional cost to Taylor County.

Concurrent with: Taylor County Case No. 16CF45

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Restitution Summary

Attorney Kristi Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Heather L. Adams appeared in court with Attorney Wright Laufenberg.  Plea agreement put into the record.  Victim rights complied with.  Plea of no contest to Count 1 and Counts 2 through 5.  Plea colloquy.  Plea freely, voluntarily and intelligently, factual basis exists.  Court finds defendant guilty of counts 1 and 2 through 5.  Court dismisses and read in the remaining counts. Statement by Attorney Attorney Tlusty and Attorney Laufenberg.  Court orders a withheld sentence with placement on probation for a period of 8 years on Count 1 and 4 years on counts 2 through 5.   Conditions of probation are 12 months county jail on count 1 to begin no later than November 11, 2017 at 4:30 pm. concurrent with 15CF45.   The jail sentence may be served with huber and court grants request that huber may include child care and online education; court costs on each count.  DNA sample and surcharge; surcharge is on count 1; AODA and comply with treatment recommendations; maintain full time employment or school; no contact with co-defendants D.C., D.R., and N.H.; absolute sobriety and must not consume any controlled substances except as prescribed; counseling as deemed appropriate by probation; restitution joint and several.  - rt

Attorney Kristi Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Heather L. Adams appeared in person with Attorney Wright Laufenberg.  There was a discussion regarding the bonds that were forfeited. Attorney Laufenberg indicated that he was objecting to the bond forfeitures because he requested the bond hearings be adjourned.  The court ordered that collection of the bond forfeitures be held in abeyance and  the issues of the bond forfeitures will be heard on a different date.  Court ordered on all the cases that bonds were forfeited that signature bonds that were originally ordered are ordered again with the same conditions that were originally ordered.  All of the defendant's cases are scheduled for a pretrial conference on December 1, 2016 at 3:00 pm.  - rt
